description: Pacific Gas and Electric Company's Electric Schedule E-TOU-D is a residential time-of-use (TOU) peak pricing rate structure for electricity usage between 5 - 8 p.m. on non-holiday weekdays. This voluntary schedule is available to residential customers on an opt-in basis and applies to all areas where PG&E provides electric service. The rate structure takes into account various factors such as seasonal changes, billing, and additional charges, offering different rates for peak and off-peak hours during summer and winter seasons.

Summer.Peak: 5:00 p.m. to 8:00 p.m. Monday through Friday

Winter.Peak: 5:00 p.m. to 8:00 p.m. Monday through Friday

electricity_costs.explanation: The kWh costs for each period are based on the Total Energy Rates mentioned in the text under 'TOTAL BUNDLED RATES'. Summer and Winter seasons have different rates for Peak and Off-Peak periods.

fixed_costs.explanation: The text mentions a minimum cost, referred to as the 'Delivery Minimum Bill Amount', which is $0.39167 per meter per day. This charge is applied to the delivery portion of the bill, including all rate components other than the generation rate.
